newsitem.title: ITALY: Florence airport cargo capacity not fully utilised.
newsitem.headline: Florence airport cargo capacity not fully utilised.

text.p: The reorganised cargo terminal at Florence's Amerigo Vespucci airport is not yet being fully utilised although traffic in the first four months of this year was up 50 percent on the same period of 1996, the airport authority (SAF) said.

The terminal operating since November 1995, is now operating at a rate of 750 tonnes a year compared to a capacity of 1,500 tonnes. Last year it handled 300 tonnes of cargo carried on both charter and passenger flights.
Cargo charters included seven Meridiana flights, three for Lufthansa, three for Sabena/Swissair's Swisscargo carrier and two arrivals for Tyrolean.

The new terminal provides all-day warehousing Monday to Friday and for half of Saturday. Cargo acceptance is two hours before departure for national flights and three hours before for non-EU cargo. - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+ 44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017 - www.racs.com
